node.title: Julie in France is getting $16,000 to switch to an EV. Spoiler: You're not
node.alt: A brunette woman and a young boy before a new white car
node.description: Governments around the world are offering juicy purchase incentives to speed car ownership to EVs. Here's what they're offering and how it compares with Australia.
node.content:
["When Julie Hoang needed to upgrade the family's ageing diesel car, she didn't at first consider buying an electric vehicle (EV).", "Then she saw the subsidies, and pretty soon she was swanning around in a sleek white electric Peugeot.", "\"I definitely wouldn't have bought one without the subsidies,\" she says.", "The four-door hatchback would have cost an eye-watering $50,000, but the government gave her an $11,000 rebate.", "On top of this, it bought back her diesel clunker for about $5,000.", "\"That's a higher value than what it's worth,\"\u00a0Julie\u00a0said.", "All up, the subsidy and buy-back reduced the cost of the car to\u00a0$34,000; more expensive than a diesel model, but not by too much.", "The catch? (And sorry to get your hopes up).", "Julie lives in France.\u00a0", "", "
Public EV chargers are fast becoming a familiar sight in European cities.(Getty: Carsten Koall)
", "Governments around the world are offering juicy purchase incentives to speed car ownership to EVs \u2014\u00a0and it appears to be working.", "EVs made up 22 per cent of new car sales in France in September 2021.", "In Australia, which has some small state EV subsidies but no overarching national ones,\u00a0EVs account for about 1.6\u00a0per cent of new car sales.", "Industry groups have been calling for sizeable national incentives for years and hoped they'd arrive with a long-anticipated federal government EV strategy, which was released last week.", "But they didn't arrive: The Prime Minister ruled them out, saying Australians would have to wait for the carmakers to offer cheaper cars.", "\"I trust Australians that when they are presented with good options at good prices \u2014\u00a0they'll make good choices,\" he said.", "So what subsidies and tax concessions (known collectively as purchase incentives) are other governments dangling before the car-buying\u00a0public?", "Here's\u00a0what's on offer in Australia, compared to a selection of other countries around the world.", "
Australia
", "But these purchase incentives are, or will be,\u00a0cancelled out by\u00a0\"EV taxes\" in some states:", "
New Zealand
", "New Zealand offers rebates of $NZ8,625 for new EVs and $NZ3,450 for used ones, and has\u00a0flagged a \"cash for clunkers\" buyback scheme.", "
United States
", "EV buyers\u00a0get a federal tax credit of up to $US7,500 and President Joe Biden is pushing to increase that figure to $US12,500 for US-made models.", "There are also extra state-based EV subsidies.\u00a0In California, residents can access a rebate of up\u00a0to $US7,000 on new EVs.", "", "
An electric vehicle charging station in California.(Getty: Frederic J. Brown)
", "
China
", "The world's largest EV market has electric car subsidies of 18,000 Yuan ($3,822).", "
United Kingdom
", "The UK offers grants of up to 3,000 British pounds ($5,500), as well as other incentives, such as exemption from the vehicle excise duty and London's congestion charge.", "
Ireland
", "Ireland offers subsidies and tax relief of up to 10,000 euros ($15,700) for purchasing a new EV.", "
Germany
", "Germany has EV subsidies of up to 9,000 Euros ($14,200).", "German carmakers are also offering generous diesel vehicle buyback schemes, ranging from 6,000 ($9,400) to 10,000 euros ($15,700).", "", "
Volkswagen employees assemble the body and powertrain of a VW EV in a Dresden factory.(Getty: Sebastian Kahnert)
", "
Norway
", "Norway offers generous exemptions from various carbon,\u00a0road and sales taxes that make EVs cheaper to buy than petrol or diesel\u00a0cars.", "In September 2021, EVs made up 77.5 per cent of all new cars sold in the country.", "
Are Australia's incentives enough?
", "The Grattan Institute\u00a0says that to get Australia's transport sector emissions to net zero by 2050,\u00a050 per cent of new car sales will need to be zero-emissions vehicles by 2030\u00a0and 100\u00a0per cent by 2035.", "(Zero-emission vehicles can also be hydrogen cars, but most of the time we're talking about EVs, which are much more popular.)", "
How feasible is this with existing incentives?
", "According to government modelling, we will fall short of these targets.", "The\u00a0federal government's EV strategy released last week\u00a0estimates that, under current policy settings (and without national rebates), EVs\u00a0will make up only\u00a030 per cent\u00a0of\u00a0new\u00a0light vehicle sales by 2030.", "The EV strategy states: \"Reducing the total cost of ownership through subsidies would not represent value for the taxpayer, particularly as industry is rapidly working through technological developments to make battery electric vehicles cheaper.\"", "France, meanwhile, has seen\u00a0so many EV sales that it's even slightly reduced its subsidies since Julie bought her Peugeot.", "Speaking from a small village in the south of France, Julie said she was also benefiting\u00a0from a low-interest loan for EV purchases, as well as avoiding paying\u00a0sales tax to insure the car.", "\"It reduces the insurance quite a bit,\" she said.", "These incentives haven't removed all the barriers to buying an EV\u2014\u00a0there's still the problem of limited public chargers and a new anxiety about running out of juice if she ventures to Lyon or Marseille.", "\"It's the blocking issue at the moment,\" she said."]
